intro: Fimbristemma brasiliense, commonly known as Brazilian starfruit or Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers and oval, fleshy fruits that are typically yellow or orange in color. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
